rules_name: Avoid duplicate conditions in "if"/"else if" and "switch" statements to eliminate dead code
rules_mdDesc: When the same conditions are used in statements like "if"/"else if" or "switch", it can lead to duplicated or dead code.

rules_name: Avoid Identical Expressions on Both Sides of a Binary Operator
rules_mdDesc: When both sides of a binary operator have identical values, the condition will always give the same result.
Avoid using Messaging.sendEmail within loops to prevent exceeding Salesforce governor limits and enhance application performance.

rules_name: Avoid using methods getDescribe and getMap inside Loops
rules_mdDesc: The ‘getDescribe’ and ‘getMap’ methods typically involve fetching metadata information for objects and fields, and invoking them inside loops can result in unnecessary overhead.

rules_name: Consider Using Assert in place of System.Assert
rules_mdDesc: Salesforce’s Assert class offers a collection of static methods that assist in creating clearer assertions within Apex test code. This new class aims to enhance the readability and maintainability of test code for developers. It is preferable to use Assert in your tests instead of older System.Assert methods.

rules_name: Lines should not be too long in APEX
rules_mdDesc: Limiting the length code lines enhances code clarity and readability by reducing complexity and improving quick understanding.

rules_name: Methods should not share the same implementations
rules_mdDesc: To avoid duplication and confusion, it is important to ensure that two methods with identical implementations are avoided.
